TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi beforefieldinit GradientDrawable extends Android.Graphics.Drawables.Drawable

Docs.summary: A Drawable with a color gradient for buttons, backgrounds, etc.

remarks.para: A Drawable with a color gradient for buttons, backgrounds, etc.
It can be defined in an XML file with the <shape> element. For more information, see the guide to Drawable Resources.

MemberSignature.Value: public override int Opacity { get; }
.property instance int32 Opacity

Docs.summary: Return the opacity/transparency of this Drawable.

remarks.para: Return the opacity/transparency of this Drawable. The returned value is one of the abstract format constants in : , , , or .

An OPAQUE drawable is one that draws all all content within its bounds, completely covering anything behind the drawable. A TRANSPARENT drawable is one that draws nothing within its bounds, allowing everything behind it to show through. A TRANSLUCENT drawable is a drawable in any other state, where the drawable will draw some, but not all, of the content within its bounds and at least some content behind the drawable will be visible. If the visibility of the drawable's contents cannot be determined, the safest/best return value is TRANSLUCENT.

Generally a Drawable should be as conservative as possible with the value it returns. For example, if it contains multiple child drawables and only shows one of them at a time, if only one of the children is TRANSLUCENT and the others are OPAQUE then TRANSLUCENT should be returned. You can use the method to perform a standard reduction of two opacities to the appropriate single output.

Note that the returned value does not necessarily take into account a custom alpha or color filter that has been applied by the client through the or methods. Some subclasses, such as , , and , do account for the value of , but the general behavior is dependent upon the implementation of the subclass.

.method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance void SetColor(class Android.Content.Res.ColorStateList colorStateList) cil managed

Docs.param: The color state list used to fill the shape
Docs.summary: Changes this drawable to use a single color state list instead of a gradient.

remarks.para: Changes this drawable to use a single color state list instead of a gradient. Calling this method with a null argument will clear the color and is equivalent to calling with the argument .
Note: changing color will affect all instances of a drawable loaded from a resource. It is recommended to invoke before changing the color.

MemberSignature.Value: public override void SetColorFilter (Android.Graphics.ColorFilter cf);
.method public hidebysig virtual instance void SetColorFilter(class Android.Graphics.ColorFilter cf) cil managed

Docs.param: the color filter to apply, or null to remove the existing color filter
Docs.summary: Specify an optional color filter for the drawable.

remarks.para: Specify an optional color filter for the drawable.
If a Drawable has a ColorFilter, each output pixel of the Drawable's drawing contents will be modified by the color filter before it is blended onto the render target of a Canvas.
Pass null to remove any existing color filter.
Note: Setting a non-null color filter disables .

Docs.param: an array containing 2 or more ARGB colors
Docs.summary: Sets the colors used to draw the gradient.

remarks.para: Sets the colors used to draw the gradient.
Each color is specified as an ARGB integer and the array must contain at least 2 colors.
Note: changing colors will affect all instances of a drawable loaded from a resource. It is recommended to invoke before changing the colors.

.method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance void SetCornerRadii(float32[] radii) cil managed

Docs.param: 4 pairs of X and Y radius for each corner, specified in pixels. The length of this array must be >= 8

remarks.para: Specify radii for each of the 4 corners. For each corner, the array contains 2 values, [X_radius, Y_radius]. The corners are ordered top-left, top-right, bottom-right, bottom-left. This property is honored only when the shape is of type .
Note: changing this property will affect all instances of a drawable loaded from a resource. It is recommended to invoke before changing this property.

Note: changing this property will affect all instances of a drawable loaded from a resource. It is recommended to invoke before changing this property.

MemberSignature.Value: protected override Type ThresholdType { get; }
.property instance class System.Type ThresholdType

Docs.summary: This API supports the Mono for Android infrastructure and is not intended to be used directly from your code.
Docs.value: A which provides the declaring type.

remarks.para: This property is used to control virtual vs. non virtual method dispatch against the underlying JNI object. When this property is equal to the declaring type, then virtual method invocation against the JNI object is performed; otherwise, we assume that the method was overridden by a derived type, and perform non-virtual methdo invocation.
